sentences.english: This was my old haunt, and it's haunted me still.
sentences.chinese: 这是我的故地，它仍然困扰我。

sentences.english: It is a neighborhood beset by all the usual inner-city problems.
sentences.chinese: 这是个为各种内城常见问题所困扰的社区。

sentences.english: Germany, like Japan, is bedevilled by chronically weak domestic demand.
sentences.chinese: 德国和日本一样，被长期的国内需求不足而困扰。

sentences.english: Then doubts and fears did assail the very strongest .
sentences.chinese: 疑惑和恐惧的确困扰过意志最坚强的人。

sentences.english: Your negative emotions aren’t there to annoy you or distract you.
sentences.chinese: 你的负面情绪不会惹恼你，或困扰你。

sentences.english: In addition, this is what perplex me a lot.
sentences.chinese: 而且，这也是困扰了我很久的问题。

sentences.english: But the narrowing of options still discomfits Chinese leaders.
sentences.chinese: 但是越来越少的选择仍然困扰着中国领导人。

sentences.english: I was plagued with dreams of explosions and screaming.
sentences.chinese: 梦中的爆炸和尖叫声困扰着我。

sentences.english: Today, at 52, he is cancer-free and healthy.
sentences.chinese: 如今他已52岁，没有癌症困扰，身体健康。
肉价问题也困扰着北京的官员。
然而有几个隐患困扰着中国。

sentences.english: But such triggers don't seem to trouble the patients with a damaged insula.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种激发看来已不会困扰岛叶皮层损伤的患者。

sentences.english: How to handle the worsted wool waste is a difficult Problem which puzzles the worsted mill for a long period of time.
sentences.chinese: 处理精纺回毛是长期困扰精纺厂的一个难题。

sentences.english: The Web has officially bugged and bedeviled a lot of people.
sentences.chinese: 网络让许多人感到困扰和迷惘。

sentences.english: Before purchase should be thoughtful, and use to see from the problems.
sentences.chinese: 购置前应考虑周到，免除使用时才发现的困扰。

sentences.english: I am still haunted by my inner conflict that day.
sentences.chinese: 那一天我内心的矛盾到现在仍然困扰着我。

definition: to endure/to suffer/to be subjected to
to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
a danger concealed within sth/hidden damage/misfortune not visible from the surface
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
